intro: Althaea triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed marshmallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with three distinct lobes. Its flowers are pink to purple, often with a white or yellow center, and it produces fluffy, cotton-like seed capsules. Althaea triloba thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
